_header: Many winter witterly / Ere Christ were born of our Lady
Subjects: Esther, queen, story of; Old Testament
_description: Story of Queen Esther, in the Northern Homily Cycle

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
MOny winter witerlyOr crist weore boren of vre
                    ladi…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Vre lord bringe vs to þat blisþat to goode men
                    greiþed is. AMEN.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Die Evangelien-Geschichten der Homiliensammlung des Ms. Vernon.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         57 (1877): 241-316: 310.

BodAsh42.First Lines:
HEre maie ȝe se þe felonieOf þe Iewes þat
                    þorgh enuye…
BodAsh42.Last Lines:
…Oure lorde bringe vs to þat blisseþat to swilk men
                    graithid is . Amen .
BodAsh42.Editions:
Thompson,  Anne B.,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Homily
                    Cycle.

CULAdd8335.First Lines:
fful many wynters witerlyOr crist was borne of oure
                    lady…
CULAdd8335.Last Lines:
…Þus til do god lene vs myghtAnd bryng vs alle til heuen
                    bright Amen

Many wyntyr wyttirlyOr crist wos borne off oure
                    leuedy…
